org.aludratest.config
Interface Configurable

All Known Subinterfaces:
AludraTestConfig
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractConfigurableAludraService, AbstractSeleniumService, AludraSelenium1, AludraSelenium2, AludraServiceRegistry, AludraTestConfigImpl, AutoRetryImpl, CommandLineServiceImpl, DataConfigurationImpl, DefaultFlatFileService, FileServiceImpl, LocalSeleniumResourceService, TAFMSSeleniumResourceService
public interface Configurable

Interface for classes which instances can be configured using the published AludraTest configuration mechanism. Service implementors should derive from AbstractConfigurableAludraService, while simple configurable components would directly implement this interface.
Instances implementing this interface will be configured automatically when they are retrieved via the getService() or newComponentInstance() methods of the AludraTestContext object. Consider annotating your classes with the ConfigProperty or ConfigProperties annotations to document available configuration and provide default values for the framework's initialization methods.

Author:
falbrech

Method Detail

getPropertiesBaseName

String getPropertiesBaseName()
Returns the base name for properties files for this configurable, e.g. "aludratest" if the properties files are named "aludratest.properties", or "fileService" for "fileService.properties".

Returns:
The base name for properties files for this configurable, never null.

fillDefaults

void fillDefaults(MutablePreferences preferences)
Called by the framework to let the configurable object fill its defaults in a Preferences structure. This could be a no-op, or could even include creating complex sub-tree structures.
The framework has already filled the passed preferences object with the default values derived from ConfigProperty annotations, if any are present on the implementing class or any superclass or interface.

Parameters:
preferences - The Preferences object to fill with the defaults for the configurable object.

configure

void configure(Preferences preferences)
Called by the framework to let a configurable object configure itself according to the passed Preferences object. The object is allowed to store the passed Preferences reference and query it for configuration parameters when needed. It is also OK to extract all required parameters in this method.
In any case, this method should check the configuration for validness and throw an AutomationException when the configuration is invalid.

Parameters:
preferences - Configuration object for this configurable.
Throws:
AutomationException - If the configuration contains invalid elements.
